newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL - Liposome plummets.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL - Liposome plummets.

text.p: Shares in Liposome Co Inc plunged before Wednesday's market opening, hit by a study showing no difference between Liposome's Ventus respiratory drug and a placebo.
The Princeton, N.J., company's share was trading at 13-1/2, far below a Tuesday closing price of 24-13/16.
"The stock is getting hammered," a trader said.

The company said in a statement early Wednesday that its Phase III study of the drug to treat acute respiratory distress syndrome showed no difference between the patients receiving the drug and a placebo.
Liposome's chairman and chief executive, Charles Baker, said he was "very disappointed" with the results.
In later pre-open trade, Liposome stock continued lower, reaching 12, a trader said.

In other active shares, Boston Chicken Inc was at 14-1/2 from a Tuesday closing price of 15-7/16. The drop came after the restaurant chain said in a conference call its planned new store openings would be below expectations, its 1997 and 1998 earnings would be hurt by the openings and the company would see sales weakness in the current quarter.

Spyglass Inc was trading at 8-7/8, from a closing price of nine, after it announced an expected third-quarter loss of $0.26 to $0.30 share. Spyglass also has formed a technology alliance with Geoworks Inc.
Among telecom stocks, Sweden's Telefon AB L.M. Ericsson was at 39 from a closing price of 38-1/4 and Finland's Nokia Group was at 76 from a close of 74.
Traders said the Nordic telecommunications equipment makers were boosted by higher price targets for the shares from Smith Barney analyst Tony Langham.
